item.title: Simulating a Binomial Event
item.description: Simulation Confidence Learning a population proportion Simulation This is going to be a simple experiment, we want to simulate a dice game and iteratively improve our confidence in the fairness of those dice. Theoretically rolling a 7 or 11 should happen with P = .222 (8/36). set.seed(234) dice <- c(1,2,3,4,5,6) d1 <- replicate(1000, sample(dice,1)) d2 <- replicate(1000, sample(dice,1)) rolls <- d1 + d2 fair_711 <- ifelse(rolls == 7 | rolls == 11, 1, 0) mean(fair_711) ## [1] 0.
